title: Whistleblower Raises Questions About Boeing 737 MAX, FAA Safety Inspectors
text:
An old whistleblower complaint is causing new problems for the Federal Aviation Administration—and for Boeing.

The U.S. Office of Special Counsel, a federal investigative agency, alleged insufficient safety training for federal aviation safety inspectors. Some of the inspectors are connected with the troubled Boeing (ticker: BA) 737 MAX jet, which has been grounded worldwide since mid-March after two deadly crashes that killed 346 people. The complaint originated with a whistleblower who is an aviation safety inspector

...
description: An old complaint is causing new problems for the Federal Aviation Administration—and for Boeing.
